intro: Stephanomeria neomexicana, commonly known as the New Mexico starflower, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its foliage consists of narrow, linear leaves, and it produces small, star-shaped yellow flowers. Stephanomeria neomexicana is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and slopes, contributing to local biodiversity.
